thread.title: Local Roundup for Oct. 16

title: Local Roundup for Oct. 16
text: The Daily Courier Loveall throws 4 TDs in 62-0 win over Valley LutheranBAGDAD, Ariz. - Quarterback Israel Loveall completed 6 of 8 passes for 144 yards and four touchdowns as the Bagdad football team shutout Valley Lutheran 62-0 on Friday night."This was the most disciplined we've played all season," Bagdad head coach Dalton Mills said. "This was a complete game by our team and they looked good."Connor Pacheco had seven carries for 65 yards and two touchdowns while Benjamin Loveall had three catches for 83 yards and a score. Jordin O'Neil added two catches for 82 yards and two scores, and on the last play of the first quarter he returned an interception for a touchdown.The Sultans led 46-0 at the end of the first quarter.Bagdad [8-1 Overall], which is ranked No. 4 in the Division VI power point poll, will now wait to see if they get a first-round bye in the state playoffs, or have to play on Friday, Oct. 23. The brackets are scheduled to be released tonight on www.aia365.com.Cougars lose shutout in final minute, beat N. Pointe 26-6PHOENIX - Josh Fisher, Justin Ward, Taylor Marshall and Tyler Gianfrancesco each scored a touchdown for the Chino Valley football team in a 26-6 victory over North Pointe Preparatory on Friday night.The scores came after the Cougars failed to score on their first two possessions, turning the ball over to North Pointe on both occasions."We finally got things together after those two turnovers," Chino Valley head coach Wade Krug said. "Our defense played well and our whole team had an outstanding game."North Pointe would score a touchdown in the final minute of play, but by that time the Cougars were already celebrating.Next up, Chino Valley [3-5 Overall] will host Mohave Accelerated on Friday, Oct. 23, then hit the road in the 2015 season finale against Joy Christian on Friday, Oct. 29. Kickoff for both games is scheduled for 7 p.m.Follow Brian M. Bergner Jr. on Twitter at @SportsWriter52 or reach him by phone at 928-445-3333, ext. 1106, or 928-899-6946.
